page.title: 12Arable farming-Crops
page.content: In our area most farmers grow crops of some kind or another.The most common are wheat,barley,potatoes,sugar beet and oil-seed rape. Most farmers grow crops to sell and they are called cash crops. Potatoes are an important cash crop and so is wheat.Some farmers grow their crops to feed their animals because it is cheaper than buying food for them. Crops will not grow on rocky hills and the soil must be soft and fertile.Wheat can be used to make white bread and with barley you can make beer.Potatoes have lots of roots and are used for eating. Sugar beet is another root crop from which we extract sugar.The local processing plant is at Felsted. Oil-seed rape is the newest crop and is used for low grade vegtable oil.
